Class DataController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tractrac.subscription.lib.impl.DataController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class DataController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The main class for data subscription/retrieval.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Jan Marthedal Rasmussen

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  DataController.Listener
      Provides information on the status of live and stored data.
      static interface  DataController.TimeListener
      A callback that will be called when the UTC time of the live data server is received.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataController

        public DataController(java.net.URI liveUri,
              java.net.URI storedUri,
              DataController.Listener listener,
              java.lang.String threadPrefix)
               throws com.tractrac.dataflow.lib.api.ProviderCreationException
        Creates a data dataControllerAsio to be used when subscribing data. Supported live data URI's:
        • tcp://example.com:1234
        Supported stored data URI's:
        • tcp://example.com:1234
        • http://example.com/stored.mtb
        • file:/c:/tests/stored.mtb
        Parameters:
        liveUri - the URI for live data. null is allowed, in which case no live data will be received.
        storedUri - the URI for stored data. null is allowed, in which case no stored data will be received.
        listener -
        threadPrefix - prefix to create the threads
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        com.tractrac.dataflow.lib.api.ProviderCreationException

        public void run()
        Specified by:

      • getUtcTime

        public void getUtcTime(DataController.TimeListener timeListener)
        Requests the UTC time of the data server.

        The answer will arrive asynchronously through the provided callback.

        Note that the answer will only arrive once the connection to the live server has been established (e.g., after the DataControllerAsio.Listener.liveDataConnected() call)

        Parameters:
        timeListener -

      • stop

        public void stop(boolean abortStored)
        Stop receiving live and stored data
        Parameters:
        abortStored - true if processes currently fetching stored data should be stopped; otherwise, these processes will be allowed to finish
